intro: Orthocarpus mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
